column4: I have an install disk for MSFURY3 (a game written for Windows 95).  It won't install under windows 7 because it's apparently 16-bit and my installation of win7 is 32-bit.  I'm trying to install it on ubuntu, using wine, but ubuntu refuses to run it, citing issues with the executable bit.  I can't change the executable bit because this is a CD.  Can I override ubuntu's aversion to running things without the executable bit, or will I need t
o copy the CD, edit the iso to give setup.exe an executable bit, mount the iso with an iso mounting program, and run the setup that way?
I would think you have less than 2% chance of succeeding without a real emulator
have you considered installing Win98 or Win95 in a VM?
